conversation.content: I noticed you've been [flirtatious] working late again. Third night this week.
Yeah, well, I'm trying to finish this grant proposal, you know, but honestly, my mind keeps wandering to, uh, other things whenever you walk by my office.
That's, um, I mean [stuttering] I wasn't trying to, er, distract you or anything.
No no, it's not, like, a bad distraction - actually, having you around makes these late nights, hmm, bearable, and I guess I've been hoping you'd stop by to chat.
I just thought, well, you might [very meekly] want some coffee, so, or maybe, um, some company.

Coffee would be, ah, perfect! You know, I was just [animated] thinking how this place feels, basically, less lonely when you're here, and honestly, your timing is always somehow exactly when I need a break.
Sometimes I wonder if we're [slurring] both just, you know, avoiding going home to, err, empty apartments, I mean.
God, that's, umm, exactly it - here's the thing, at least here we have each other's company, even if we're just, sort of, working in parallel most of the time.
It's comfortable, I guess, this, um, routine we've developed, you know, without really, like, planning it.
Right? We've somehow created this, well, unspoken agreement where we just, basically, exist in the same space, and it's actually become the best part of my day.
Mine too, if I'm being honest.
Listen, I've been, err, meaning to ask - would you maybe want to, [whispering] you know, grab actual dinner sometime instead of just, um, vending machine snacks at midnight?
That would be [yawn] nice. A real meal sounds good.
Perfect! There's this place downtown that stays open late, serves incredible Thai food, and the atmosphere is really cozy - we could go tomorrow if you're free?
Tomorrow works, uh, assuming we don't, like, end up here until, well, midnight again somehow.
Ha, yeah, so, let's make it a firm plan - 7 PM, and actually, we'll both leave on time for once, I mean, no excuses allowed.
Okay, that's, hmm, reasonable, though I should probably, you know, finish this report first.
See, this is, basically, exactly our problem - we're both terrible at, er, leaving work at work, but honestly, maybe that's why we understand each other.
I suppose we do [confidently] understand each other pretty well by now.
We really do, and I think, um, that's [very sincerely] what makes this, whatever this is between us, feel so, well, naturally right somehow.
